dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, they're actually thinking about changing when people start work?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, they're actually thinking about changing when people start work?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, uh, exactly. It's Astana, and they want to, um, reduce traffic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, uh, exactly. It's Astana, and they want to, um, reduce traffic.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Astana is considering adjusting the work schedules of central executive bodies (ministries) to reduce the load on the city's transport system by distributing passenger traffic more evenly.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Traffic? How's that even going to help with traffic, though? Like, just changing a time?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Traffic? How's that even going to help with traffic, though? Like, just changing a time?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the Deputy Akim, Yersin Otebayev, he, uh, said they're trying to spread out the passenger traffic more evenly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the Deputy Akim, Yersin Otebayev, he, uh, said they're trying to spread out the passenger traffic more evenly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Deputy Akim of the capital, Yersin Otebayev, stated during a Maslikhat meeting that in 2018, the start of the Akimat's workday was shifted to 8:30 AM.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, okay. So not everyone, just, like, government workers?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, okay. So not everyone, just, like, government workers?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Primarily central executive bodies, ministries, yeah. They already did it for the Akimat in 2018, shifted to 8:30 AM.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Primarily central executive bodies, ministries, yeah. They already did it for the Akimat in twenty eighteen, shifted to eight thirty a m.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Astana is considering adjusting the work schedules of central executive bodies (ministries) to reduce the load on the city's transport system... Deputy Akim of the capital, Yersin Otebayev, stated during a Maslikhat meeting that in 2018, the start of the Akimat's workday was shifted to 8:30 AM.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Right. And now they're thinking of, like, a thirty-minute or an hour shift for them?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. And now they're thinking of, like, a thirty-minute or an hour shift for them?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: For those central bodies, yeah. It's still under discussion, whether it's 30 minutes or an hour. They'll coordinate, too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For those central bodies, yeah. It's still under discussion, whether it's thirty minutes or an hour. They'll coordinate, too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Whether it will be by 30 minutes or an hour is still under discussion. We will coordinate with our education, healthcare, and other organizations," said Otebayev.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: But, like, will that really make a difference? Thirty minutes? It just seems so small.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But, like, will that really make a difference? Thirty minutes? It just seems so small.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Otebayev thinks so. He says it helps balance traffic flow, especially if public transport drivers adjust their routes earlier too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Otebayev thinks so. He says it helps balance traffic flow, especially if public transport drivers adjust their routes earlier too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: "If every public transport passenger had their work start time shifted by 30 minutes, drivers would have to start their routes earlier as well. This would help ensure a more balanced traffic flow.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Hmm. Seems like, um, a really small thing for such a big problem, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hmm. Seems like, um, a really small thing for such a big problem, you know?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: He actually emphasized it's quicker to implement than, say, building new roads or investing huge amounts. Less financial investment, faster results.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He actually emphasized it's quicker to implement than, say, building new roads or investing huge amounts. Less financial investment, faster results.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Otebayev also emphasized that unlike other measures to ease road infrastructure congestion, which require significant financial investment and long-term implementation, this step can be quickly developed and show results in the near future.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, a quick fix, then? Or, uh, just an idea they're exploring?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, a quick fix, then? Or, uh, just an idea they're exploring?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: He did say it needs further study, but they're working on it together. It's, uh, a collaborative thing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He did say it needs further study, but they're working on it together. It's, uh, a collaborative thing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, this issue requires further study, and we will work on it together," he added.
